Line 13: Line 13:
The name '''Orca''', which is another term for a [[Orca|killer whale]], is a nod to the long-standing Assistive Technology product on Windows called [[JAWS (screen reader)|JAWS]], which is the name of a [[Jaws (film)|fictional shark]].
The name '''Orca''', which is another term for a [[Orca|killer whale]], is a nod to the long-standing Assistive Technology product on Windows called [[JAWS (screen reader)|JAWS]], which is the name of a [[Jaws (film)|fictional shark]].
â
As of GNOME 2.16, Orca is a part of the GNOME platform. As a result, Orca is already provided by default on a number of operating system distributions, including [[OpenSolaris|Open Solaris]], [[openSUSE|openSUSE]], and [[Ubuntu_%28Linux_distribution%29|Ubuntu]].
+
As of GNOME 2.16, Orca is a part of the GNOME platform. As a result, Orca is already provided by default on a number of operating system distributions, including [[OpenSolaris|Open Solaris]], [[openSUSE|openSUSE]], and [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]].
